abstract: Security researches say that Stuxnet, designers of the computer worm that was used to vandalize an Iranian nuclear site in 2010, may be behind new virus called Duqu, intended to steal digital information that may be needed to mount a similar attack.
snippet: Stuxnet, a worm that infected computers in 155 countries and was used to vandalize an Iranian nuclear site last year, may have struck again.
lead_paragraph: Stuxnet, a worm that infected computers in 155 countries and was used to vandalize an Iranian nuclear site last year, may have struck again.

headline.main: New Malicious Program by Creators of Stuxnet Is Suspected
headline.print_headline: New Worm By Creators Of Stuxnet Is Suspected
headline.seo: Stuxnet Computer Worm’s Creators May Be Active Again
